actions.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources requested executive comment from Department of Agriculture, OMB.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Murkowski without amendment. With written report No. 106-115.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 223.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.
Received in the House.
Held at the desk.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Forests and Forest Health.
Mr. Young (AK) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 1088.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Cleared for White House.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 106-458.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Forests and Public Land Management
Subcommittee on Forests and Forest Health

official_title: A bill to authorize the Secretary of Agriculture to convey certain administrative sites in national forests in the State of Arizona, to convey certain land to the City of Sedona, Arizona for a wastewater treatment facility, and for other purposes.
short_title: Arizona National Forest Improvement Act of 2000

summary.text: Arizona National Forest Improvement Act of 1999 - Authorizes the Secretary of Agriculture to convey: (1) specified National Forest System land and administrative sites in Arizona; and (2) sell specified land to the city of Sedona, Arizona, for construction of an effluent disposal system in Yavapai County, Arizona. Makes such funds available to the Secretary without further Act of appropriation for: (1) acquisition, construction, or improvement of administrative facilities for the Coconino, Kaibab, Prescott, and Tonto National Forests; or (2) other land in Arizona.

titles.title: Arizona National Forest Improvement Act of 1999
Arizona National Forest Improvement Act of 1999
Arizona National Forest Improvement Act of 2000

A bill to authorize the Secretary of Agriculture to convey certain administrative sites in national forests in the State of Arizona, to convey certain land to the City of Sedona, Arizona for a wastewater treatment facility, and for other purposes.
